comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: Firstly, we know Roberts was in London from 1881-1885. Secondly, Talma Studio was not founded until c.1894* by Andrew Barrie [formerly of Stewart & Co. where Barrie and Roberts were colleagues] and Sir Henry Weedon, Lord Mayor of Melbourne. *Jack Cato, The Story of the Camera in Australia, p. 94 says about 1895 but there are some 1894 photos in your collection - eg. acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=441700 . 1894 is the earliest date I can find for any Talma photo.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] I thought you would have fun with this.  Watching with interest.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
There is a 1893 reference to the Talma Studio -
" We [The Argus?] have received from the Talma Photographic Studio, Swanston-street, a really excellent cabinet portrait of Sir Henry Parkes, taken last week. "
from - The Argus (Melbourne) Saturday 02/09/1893, p.9, col.5 - at the end of a very long boring article starting on the previous page - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/page/301999 . Coincidentally (?) Tom Roberts painted Sir Henry Parkes the previous year in 1892 - nga.gov.au/federation/Detail.cfm?WorkID=26209

comment.realname: State Library of New South Wales

comment._content: This image is part of a small set of four, which have been given the date span 1880-1920 on our catalogue. Great info Pelle and Beachcomber - I'll amend the date on this one to c. 1895...  EG

[Hope you're well Roert W.]

comment.author: 51809917@N00
comment._content: The unusual lid he's wearing is apparently a Chaco War Paraguayan army style pith helmet and not an odd bowler felt hat.  Explaining the vent knob on the top.
